text.__SUMMARY__:
Neonothopanus nambi is a poisonous and bioluminescent mushroom in the family Marasmiaceae.Italian-Argentinian naturalist Carlo Luigi Spegazzini described the species in 1883 as Agaricus nambí in the subgenus Pleurotus, from material collected in December 1879 near Guarapí in Brazil. Pier Andrea Saccardo placed it in the genus Pleurotus.
Ronald H. Petersen and Irmgard Krisai placed the fungus in the new genus Neonothopanus in 1999.
